commentBody:
Have you read "I am Charlotte Simmons" by Tom Wolfe? [2004]

A young woman, daughter of a West Virginia coal miner, goes to an elite college, much as you described. In the end, character rules. Tom Wolfe spent a lot of time visiting, talking to, and learning from kids in college.

Then, or course there is the 2005 memoirs of Jennette Walls, Glass Castle.
The startling thing was difficulty of overcoming the inertia of cultural impoverishment.
In the end, family-bonds rule.
